plotSummary.brief: INT. HOTEL - ROOM 237 - M.S. / INT. HOTEL - DANNY'S BEDROOM - C.S. / INT. HOTEL - CORRIDOR - M.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Room 237 and intercutting. Medium close shot Jack over Young Lady as they kiss. He opens his eyes and reacts. He pulls back from Young Lady - camera pans left-right onto mirror. Jack and Woman reflected in it. He sees that she is covered with scars (rotting flesh). He takes his arms away from her - she starts to laugh. Cut to Danny's bedroom - medium close shot Danny shaking his head. WOMAN LAUGHING OFF. Cut to Room 237 bathroom - medium shot Elderly Woman lying in water in bath. WOMAN LAUGHING OFF. Cut to medium shot Jack shaking his head as he backs out of bathroom. Medium shot - Naked Elderly Woman laughing as she walks forward with outstretched arms. Cut to Danny's bedroom - close shot Danny shaking his head. WOMAN LAUGHING OFF. Cut to Room 237 - medium shot Naked Elderly Woman lying in water in bath. WOMAN LAUGHING OFF. Medium shot - Jack backs down steps into living room. WOMAN LAUGHING OFF. Medium shot - Naked Elderly Woman laughing as she walks forward with outstretched arms. Cut to Danny's bedroom - close shot Danny shaking his head. WOMAN LAUGHING OFF. Cut to Room 237 bathroom - medium shot Naked Elderly Woman lying in water in bath. She starts to sit up. WOMAN LAUGHING OFF. Cut to corridor - medium shot - Jack backs out of Room 237 into corridor. He closes the door and locks it - then backs away along corridor. He exits camera-left. WOMAN LAUGHING OFF.
plotSummary.subtext: Hotel's seduction reveals true nature - beauty is death. Jack's horror at discovering he kissed rotting corpse. Elderly woman pursuing him with outstretched arms - mockery of embrace. Jack locks door to contain horror but it's already inside him. Danny experiences entire traumatic sequence psychically.

characterInsights.Jack: Horrified by hotel's trick, backs away shaking head, locks door - but corruption already internalized
characterInsights.Danny: Forced to witness entire horrifying sequence multiple times through rapid intercuts

supernaturalElements: Woman transforms from beautiful to rotting corpse

location.description: Interior - Room 237 bathroom/bedroom, Danny's bedroom, corridor outside 237

time.narrative: WEDNESDAY night - Jack's horror and escape

Jack.state: Horrified, backing away, shaking head, fleeing, locking door
Jack.arc: Discovers hotel's seduction was trap - kissed rotting corpse. Tries to contain/escape horror but already corrupted.

Danny.state: Close shot showing maximum trauma, head shaking throughout, hearing laughter
Danny.arc: Psychically experienced father's sexual encounter, horror reveal, flight - severe trauma

Elderly naked corpse pursues him with outstretched arms, cackling. Rapid intercutting emphasizes Danny's forced psychic witnessing of entire trauma. Jack locks door but corruption internalized. Woman's mocking laughter continues off-screen. Hotel punishes Jack's sexual temptation by revealing death underneath beauty.

Halloran has been trying unsuccessfully to reach the Overlook by phone after his psychic vision.

plotSummary.brief: INT. HOTEL - JACK'S APARTMENT / BEDROOM - M.S. & M.C.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Apartment, continuous. They move left-right into Living Room. Camera pans with them and tracks after them across room. 'Well, are you sure it was the right room? I mean, maybe Danny made a mistake?' Jack: 'He must have gone into that room - the door was open and the lights were on.' Wendy and Jack move into their bedroom. Wendy sits on bed. 'Oh, I just don't understand.' Jack sits down on bed beside her. Cut to medium close shot Wendy sobbing. 'Well what about those bruises on his neck?' Cut to medium close shot Jack over Wendy. 'Somebody did that to him.' Jack: 'I think he did it to himself.' Cut to medium close shot Wendy shakes her head. 'No! No, that's not possible.' Cut to medium close shot Jack over Wendy.
plotSummary.subtext: Jack gaslighting Wendy - suggesting Danny self-harmed. Blaming victim. Wendy resisting but weakening.

characterInsights.Jack: Gaslighting, blaming Danny for his own injuries, manipulating Wendy
characterInsights.Wendy: Sobbing, confused, resisting Jack's theory but without evidence to counter it

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL - JACK'S APARTMENT - M.C.S. / INT. OVERLOOK HOTEL - DANNY'S BEDROOM - M.S. / INT. JACK'S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - M.C.S.

plotSummary.brief: INT. HOTEL - JACK'S APARTMENT - M.C.S. / INT. OVERLOOK HOTEL - DANNY'S BEDROOM - M.S. / INT. JACK'S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - M.C.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Bedroom, continued. Medium close shot Jack over Wendy: 'Wendy, once you rule out his version of what happened, there is no other explanation - is there? It wouldn't be that different from the episode that he had before we came up here, would it?' CUT TO Danny's bedroom - medium shot Danny lying awake on his bed. Camera tracks in on him. Wendy off: 'Jack, whatever the explanation is,' CUT TO medium shot low angle door with word 'MURDER' written backwards across it. CUT TO medium close shot Danny lying awake. Camera tracks in on him. Wendy off: 'I think we have to get Danny out of here.' CUT TO bedroom - medium close shot Jack over Wendy: 'Get him out of here?' Wendy: 'Yes.' Jack: 'You mean just leave the hotel?' Wendy: 'Yes.' CUT TO Danny's bedroom - medium close shot Danny with his mouth wide open. CUT TO Hotel lobby - medium shot - Blood gushing forward from lifts and surging up into camera lens. CUT TO Jack's apartment - medium close shot Jack over Wendy: 'It is so fucking typical of you to create a problem like this when I finally have a chance to accomplish something. When I'm really into my work. I could really write my own ticket if I went back to Boulder now, couldn't I?' Medium shot Wendy and Jack sitting on bed - Jack stands up and turns to her: 'Shovelling out driveways, work in a car wash - any of that appeal to you?' Wendy: 'Jack...' Jack: 'Wendy, I have let you fuck up my life so far, but I'm not going to let you fuck this up!' He starts to move away. Medium long shot Jack walks forward from Wendy sitting on bed. He crosses living room and camera pans right-left with him to steps leading to front door. He walks away down steps, opens front door and walks away along corridor.
plotSummary.subtext: Jack completing gaslighting by referencing Danny's prior 'episode.' Wendy breaks - wants to leave. Jack explodes, blaming Wendy for ruining his life. Claims they're trapped. Danny has vision of blood elevator while parents argue. Jack storms out.

characterInsights.Jack: Explosive rage at suggestion of leaving, blaming Wendy for all his failures, prioritizing 'work' over family safety
characterInsights.Wendy: Breaking point - wants to leave hotel despite Jack's manipulation
characterInsights.Danny: Awake, hearing argument, having blood elevator vision - seeing hotel's true nature

MURDER written backwards on door = foreshadowing.

scenes.title: INT. MIAMI - HALLORAN'S APARTMENT - NIGHT - M.S. / INT. RANGER'S OFFICE - M.S.

plotSummary.brief: INT. MIAMI - HALLORAN'S APARTMENT - NIGHT - M.S. / INT. RANGER'S OFFICE - M.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Miami apartment / Ranger station intercutting. Medium shot Halloran standing, phone up to ear. Ranger over phone: 'Good evening. Forest Service.' Halloran: 'Hallo. My name's Dick Halloran. I'm the Head Chef up at the Overlook Hotel.' Ranger: 'Good evening, Mr. Halloran. What can I do for you?' Halloran: 'Sir, I've been trying to make an urgent phone call up there,' He picks up phone and walks right-left to window (camera pans with him). 'but the operator said that the phone lines are down.' Cut to Ranger's office - medium shot Ranger sitting at radio with phone to ear: 'Yes, I'm afraid a lot of lines around here are down, due to the storm.' Cut to Miami - medium shot Halloran, phone to ear, at window: 'Well, look sir, I hate to put you to any trouble, but there's a family up there all by themselves with a young kid, and with this storm and everything.' Halloran moves left-right (camera tracks with him). He puts phone on table. 'I'd sure appreciate it if you'd give them a call on your radio just to see if everything is okay.' Cut to Ranger's office - medium shot Ranger sitting at radio, phone to ear: 'I'd be glad to do that, sir. Oh why don't you call me back in about eh twenty minutes?' Halloran over phone: 'Thank you very much. I'll do that.' Ranger: 'All right, sir.' Ranger puts phone down.
plotSummary.subtext: Halloran's rescue attempt begins. Using official channels to check on family. Polite but urgent. Ranger agrees to radio check.

characterInsights.Hallorann: Resourceful, persistent, finding alternative way to check on family after phone failure

supernaturalElements: Halloran acting on psychic distress signal

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR & BALLROOM - M.L.S.

plotSummary.detailed: Hotel corridor and ballroom. Medium long shot. Jack walks forward along corridor to Ballroom. He turns left-right into Ballroom - camera tracks with him revealing CROWDED BALLROOM. MAITRE D standing at entrance: 'Good evening, Mr. Torrance.' Jack: 'Good evening.' Jack moves left-right across crowded Ballroom - camera tracks with him to Lloyd serving behind bar. Jack sits at bar. Lloyd moves to him. Jack: 'Hi Lloyd. I've been away. Now I'm back.' Lloyd: 'Good evening Mr. Torrance.' Lloyd puts dishes of olives and peanuts on bar before Jack. Cut to medium shot Jack over Lloyd. Lloyd: 'It's good to see you.' Jack: 'It's good to be back, Lloyd.' Cut to medium close shot Lloyd. Lloyd: 'What'll it be, sir?' Cut to medium shot Jack over Lloyd. Jack: 'Hair of the dog that bit me.' Cut to medium close shot Lloyd: 'Bourbon on the rocks.' Cut to medium shot Jack over Lloyd. Jack: 'That'll do her.' Jack takes handful of peanuts and empties them into his mouth. Lloyd puts ice into glass.
plotSummary.subtext: Hotel fully welcoming Jack back after rage. Full supernatural party now visible. Jack treated as regular/returning customer. 'I've been away. Now I'm back' = Jack acknowledging he belongs to hotel now.

characterInsights.Jack: Accepted by supernatural ballroom, feeling he's 'back' where he belongs, consuming alcohol again
characterInsights.Lloyd: Ghost bartender treating Jack as regular customer, preparing his drink

supernaturalElements: Jack fully integrated into ghost world

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL BALLROOM - M.S. / M.L.S.

plotSummary.detailed: Gold Ballroom. Series of cuts between Jack and Lloyd. Jack tries to pay for drinks but Lloyd refuses: 'No charge to you, Mr. Torrance. Your money's no good here. Orders from the house.' Jack asks who's buying - Lloyd: 'It's not a matter that concerns you, Mr. Torrance - at least not at this point.' Jack accepts: 'Anything you say, Lloyd.' Jack turns from bar, dances forward to center of room. Woman enters, waiter GRADY carrying tray of drinks bumps into woman, staggers forward colliding with Jack, spilling drinks down front of Jack's jacket. Grady apologizes profusely: 'Oh dear, oh dear. I'm so sorry, sir. Oh! I've made an awful mess of your jacket, sir.'
plotSummary.subtext: Hotel owns Jack now - his money worthless, drinks free. Supernatural payment system. 'Orders from the house' = hotel's will. 'Not at this point' = ominous future implication. Grady collision 'accidental' but orchestrated by hotel to introduce Jack to former caretaker who murdered family.

characterInsights.Lloyd: Cryptic about payment source, hints at Jack's deeper involvement to come

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL BALLROOM & CORRIDOR TO MEN'S TOILET - M.L.S.

plotSummary.brief: INT. HOTEL BALLROOM & CORRIDOR TO MEN'S TOILET - M.L.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Ballroom. Grady takes advocaat glass from Jack, puts it on tray: 'Oh dear oh dear... I've made an awful mess of your jacket, sir. I'm afraid it's advocaat sir. It tends to stain.' Jack: 'Advocaat is it?' Grady: 'Yes sir. Look um... I think the best thing is to come along to the gentlemen's room, sir... we'll get some water to it, sir.' Grady picks up tray. Jack and Grady walk away to Gentlemen's. Jack pats Grady on back: 'Looks as though you might have got a spot of it on yourself there, Jeevesy old boy.' Grady: 'That doesn't matter, sir. You're the important one.' Jack: 'Awfully nice of you to say. Of course I intend to change my jacket this evening before the fish and goose soiree.' Grady: 'Very wise, sir. Very wise.' They enter Gentlemen's Toilet.
plotSummary.subtext: Grady orchestrating private conversation under pretense of cleaning stain. Jack calling him 'Jeevesy' = treating ghost as servant. Grady's deference ('You're the important one') flattering Jack. Jack's mention of 'fish and goose soiree' = accepting party as real, fully immersed in 1920s ghost world.

characterInsights.Jack: Treats Grady as servant ('Jeevesy'), completely accepts 1920s party reality, mentions attending evening soiree
characterInsights.Grady: Obsequious servant persona, flatters Jack ('You're the important one'), guides him to private space

scenes.title: INT. MEN'S TOILET - M.L.S. / M.S.

plotSummary.detailed: Men's toilet. Jack holds door open. Grady enters, puts tray on basins, soaks serviette under tap. Jack sets bourbon and advocaat down. Grady sponges Jack's jacket. Jack asks: 'What do they call you around here, Jeevesy?' Grady: 'Grady, sir. Delbert Grady.' Jack reacts: 'Grady? Delbert Grady.' Grady continues sponging. Jack asks: 'Mr. Grady... haven't I seen you somewhere before?' Grady: 'Why no, sir. I don't believe so.' Jack presses: 'Eh... Mr. Grady... weren't you once the caretaker here?' Grady: 'Why no, sir. I don't believe so.' Jack continues: 'You er a married man, are you, Mr. Grady?' Grady: 'Yes, sir. I have a wife and eh two daughters, sir.' Jack: 'And, er... where are they now?' Grady: 'Oh, they're somewhere around. I'm not quite sure at the moment, sir.' Jack takes serviette, wipes hand, throws it in basin: 'Mr. Grady, you were the caretaker here. I recognize you. I saw your picture in the newspapers. You eh... chopped your wife and daughters up into little bits, and eh... and you blew your brains out.'
plotSummary.subtext: Jack recognizes Grady from newspaper story. Grady feigning ignorance while Jack confronts him with murder facts. Grady's evasiveness about family location = they're dead. Jack stating facts bluntly = testing reality, confirming hotel's supernatural nature.

characterInsights.Jack: Direct confrontation, remembers newspaper story, tests Grady's identity, blunt about murder
characterInsights.Grady: Maintains servant role while denying being 'that' Grady, evasive about family, casual about not knowing where wife/daughters are

supernaturalElements: Grady as ghost denying his own murder history
Dead man claiming to have living family 'somewhere around'

scenes.title: INT. MEN'S TOILET - M.L.S. / M.S. / M.C.S.

plotSummary.brief: INT. MEN'S TOILET - M.L.S. / M.S. / M.C.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Men's toilet. Series of cuts between Grady and Jack. Grady responds: 'That's strange, sir. I don't have any recollection of that at all. Mr. Grady, you were the caretaker here.' Then critically: 'I'm sorry to differ with you, sir, but you are the caretaker. You have always been the caretaker, I should know, sir. I've always been here.' Jack laughs nervously. Scene reveals hotel's core manipulation - reversing roles, making Jack believe he's always been caretaker.
plotSummary.subtext: PIVOTAL MOMENT - Grady flips reality. Not 'I was caretaker' but 'YOU are the caretaker. You have ALWAYS been the caretaker.' Hotel claiming Jack has always belonged here, erasing linear time. Grady's 'I've always been here' = trapped in eternal loop. Jack's laugh = nervous recognition of impossibility.

characterInsights.Jack: Laughs nervously at impossible claim - partly accepting, partly unnerved by reality shift
characterInsights.Grady: Authoritative tone shift - no longer servant, asserting metaphysical truth about Jack's eternal role

supernaturalElements: 'You have always been the caretaker' - time erasure

scenes.title: INT. MEN'S TOILET - M.C.S.

plotSummary.detailed: Men's toilet. Series of close shots alternating between Grady and Jack. Grady reveals: 'Did you know, Mr. Torrance, that your son... is attempting to bring an outside party into this situation? Did you know that?' Jack shakes head: 'No.' Grady: 'He is, Mr. Torrance.' Jack: 'Who?' Grady uses racial slur to identify Hallorann: 'A nigger cook.' Jack reacts with shock and repetition. Grady continues: 'Your son has a very great talent. I don't think you are aware how great it is, but he is attempting to use that very talent against your will.' Jack smiles: 'Well, he is a very willful boy.' Grady: 'Indeed, he is, Mr. Torrance. A very willful boy. A rather naughty boy, if I may be so bold, sir.' Jack looks about: 'It's his mother. She eh... interferes.'
plotSummary.subtext: Grady revealing Danny's psychic call to Hallorann. Using dehumanizing language to frame rescue attempt as invasion/betrayal. Framing Danny's power as disobedience 'against your will.' Jack immediately blaming Wendy ('his mother interferes') - deflecting from his own failures, accepting Grady's framing of family as obstacles.

characterInsights.Grady: Manipulative, using racist language, framing Danny's rescue attempt as betrayal, calling child 'naughty'

scenes.title: INT. MEN'S TOILET & JACK'S APARTMENT - M.C.S. / M.S.

plotSummary.brief: INT. MEN'S TOILET & JACK'S APARTMENT - M.C.S. / M.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Men's toilet. Grady suggests: 'Perhaps they need a good talking to, if you don't mind my saying so. Perhaps a bit more.' Then reveals his method: 'My girls, sir, they didn't care for the Overlook at first. One of them actually stole a packet of matches and tried to burn it down. But I corrected them, sir. And when my wife tried to prevent me from doing my duty I corrected her.' Jack smiles. INTERCUT with Jack's apartment: Wendy crying, holding cigarette, pacing between living room and bedroom. She talks to herself planning escape: 'We have the Snowcat. If the weather breaks, we might just be able to get down the mountain... I could call the Forest Rangers first... If Jack won't come with us, we'll just have to tell him that we are going by ourselves. That's all there is to it.'
plotSummary.subtext: Grady using euphemism 'corrected' for axe murder. Describing daughter's arson attempt to frame children as dangerous. Presenting wife's intervention as obstruction of 'duty.' Jack smiling = accepting murder as correction. Wendy intercut shows her planning escape while Jack receives murder instructions. Dramatic irony - she doesn't know he's being turned against her.

characterInsights.Jack: Smiling at Grady's murder confession, accepting 'correction' as legitimate duty
characterInsights.Grady: Euphemizing murder, framing violence as duty, presenting wife's intervention as obstacle

scenes.title: INT. DANNY'S BEDROOM - M.S. / M.C.S.

plotSummary.detailed: Danny's bedroom. Wendy hears 'Red Rum. Red Rum.' from Danny's room, reacts and runs to his bedroom door. She opens door: 'Danny?' Danny sitting up in bed continues: 'Red Rum. Red Rum. Red Rum.' Wendy sits beside him: 'Danny... what's the matter, hon? Are you having a bad dream?' Close-up alternating shots. Tony speaks through Danny: 'Danny's not here, Mrs. Torrance.' Wendy: 'Come on, hon, wake up. You just had a bad dream. Everything's okay.' Tony: 'Danny can't wake up, Mrs. Torrance.' Wendy: 'Danny, wake up! Come on, right now, Wake up.' Tony: 'Danny's gone away, Mrs. Torrance.' Wendy strokes his hair.
plotSummary.subtext: Danny in deep trance, Tony fully controlling him. 'Red Rum' = MURDER backwards, psychic warning. Tony's statements increasingly ominous: 'not here,' 'can't wake up,' 'gone away' = Danny's consciousness displaced by vision. Wendy doesn't understand supernatural dimension, treating as nightmare.

characterInsights.Danny: In deep psychic trance, consciousness displaced, Tony speaking through him
characterInsights.Tony: Protective alter ego warning of murder, speaking directly to Wendy

thematicElements: Mother's inability to protect from supernatural

plotSummary.brief: INT. HOTEL LOBBY & OFFICE - M.L.S. / M.S. / M.C.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Hotel lobby and office. Ranger's voice over radio: 'This is KDK 1 calling KDK 12... Are you receiving me?' Jack walks from office into inner office, stops by radio set. Ranger continues calling. Jack looks down at radio, tries to take cover off. Ranger: 'Do you read me?' Jack unscrews back of set, lifts cover off, drops it on floor. Close-up: Jack's hand touches component, pulls it out. Ranger: 'Are you recei...' Jack pulls two more components out, rattles them in hand, moves away. Radio goes silent. DISSOLVE.
plotSummary.subtext: Jack sabotaging only communication link. Ranger trying welfare check requested by Hallorann. Jack destroying radio = ensuring family can't call for help, completing isolation. Methodical destruction while ranger calling shows Jack's deliberate choice to cut off rescue. Following Grady's implicit instruction to prevent 'outside party.'

characterInsights.Jack: Methodical, deliberate, sabotaging rescue attempt, ensuring family isolation

supernaturalElements: Jack acting on hotel's will/Grady's instruction
Timing - destroying radio exactly when ranger calls

scenes.title: INT. MIAMI APARTMENT & RANGER'S OFFICE - M.S.

plotSummary.brief: INT. MIAMI APARTMENT & RANGER'S OFFICE - M.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Miami apartment. Halloran walks with phone to ear toward window. Ranger over phone: 'Good evening. Forest Service.' Halloran: 'Hallo, this is Dick Halloran again. I called a while ago about the folks at the Overlook Hotel.' Cut to Ranger's office - ranger sitting at radio, phone to ear: 'Oh yeah. We tried to contract them several times by radio, but they didn't answer. Now, maybe they've got their radio turned off or they're in a place where they can't hear it. If you like me to, I'd be glad to try them again later on.' Cut to Halloran: 'Oh, that's very nice of you. I'll call you back later. Bye.' He puts phone down, puts hand to head. Cut to BLACK FRAMES.
plotSummary.subtext: Ranger reports no radio response - because Jack just destroyed it. Ranger offering benign explanations ('radio turned off,' 'can't hear it') not knowing Jack sabotaged it. Halloran putting 'hand to head' = psychic distress, sensing something wrong. Black frames = ominous transition, darkness closing in.

characterInsights.Hallorann: Worried, pacing, psychically distressed (hand to head), rescue attempt blocked
characterInsights.Ranger: Helpful but unaware of sabotage, offering innocent explanations

plotSummary.brief: BLACK FRAMES / EXT. SKY & INT. D.C.10 - L.S. / M.C.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Black frames. Superimposition: '8 a.m.' Cut to exterior sky - D.C.10 in flight. Cut to interior D.C.10 - Halloran sitting in seat, camera tracks back revealing other passengers. Halloran turns in seat, looks left. Stewardess enters, stops beside Halloran. Halloran: 'Pardon me, miss. What time will we get to Denver?' Stewardess: 'We're due to arrive at 8:20, sir.' Halloran: 'Thank you very much.' Stewardess walks away. Halloran looks at wristwatch. DISSOLVE to interior hotel lounge - shooting through entrance onto Jack seated with back to camera, typing at table. Camera tracks forward onto Jack. DISSOLVE.
plotSummary.subtext: Time jump to morning. Halloran flying to Denver = rescue mission launched. Checking time anxiously = worried about family. Jack typing = pretending normalcy while having destroyed radio. Dissolve showing Jack working = dramatic irony, Halloran doesn't know Jack has turned murderous. Rescue and danger on collision course.

characterInsights.Jack: Typing at desk, maintaining facade while having sabotaged rescue

scenes.title: INT. DURKIN'S GARAGE & AIRPORT - M.S. (INTERCUT)

plotSummary.detailed: Durkin's garage interior. Man standing, man reading magazine. Durkin enters stamping snow off feet, moves behind counter, picks up ringing phone: 'Durkin's garage.' Halloran over phone: 'Hello, can I speak to Larry?' Durkin: 'Speaking.' CUT TO Airport - Halloran at telephone booth: 'Hello Larry. This is Dick, Dick Halloran.' Back to Durkin: 'Dick, how are you doing? How's the weather down there?' Halloran: 'I'm not in Florida, Larry. I'm calling from Stapleton Airport.' Durkin surprised: 'What the hell are you doing down there?' Halloran: 'Well, I just got in from Miami, and I've got to get up to the Overlook today. What's the weather like up there?' Durkin: 'Well, the snow ploughs are keeping things moving in town, but the mountain roads are completely blocked.' Halloran: 'That means I'm going to need a snowcat to get up there, Larry. Can you fix me up with one?' Durkin: 'What's the big deal about getting up there today, especially in this kind of weather?' Halloran LIES: 'Larry, just between you and me, we've got a very serious problem with the people who are taking care of the place. They've turned out to be completely unreliable assholes. Ullman phoned me last night, and I'm supposed to go up there and find out if they have to be replaced.' Durkin checks watch: 'How long is it going to take you to get up here?' Halloran: 'Oh about five hours. I'm gonna rent a car here at the airport.' Durkin: 'Okay, Dick - I'll take care of it.' Halloran: 'Oh thanks a lot, Larry. I really appreciate that.' Durkin: 'That's all right. Drive carefully.' Durkin puts phone down.
plotSummary.subtext: Halloran lying to get help - fabricating Ullman call and 'unreliable assholes' story to justify urgent trip. Can't explain psychic distress. Durkin cooperative, accepting cover story. Mountain roads blocked = dangerous journey ahead.

characterInsights.Hallorann: Resourceful, lying convincingly to get snowcat, can't reveal psychic reasons
characterInsights.Durkin: Helpful friend, accepts urgent request without suspicion

supernaturalElements: Halloran can't explain real reason - psychic distress signal

scenes.title: EXT. ROAD - NIGHT & INT. HALLORAN'S CAR - M.L.S. / M.C.S.

plotSummary.brief: EXT. ROAD - NIGHT & INT. HALLORAN'S CAR - M.L.S. / M.C.S.
plotSummary.detailed: DISSOLVE TO exterior road at night. Medium long shot. Halloran's car moving forward along snow-covered road. Camera tracks back with it. Voice over radio: 'Well, good morning to you, Hal and Charlie on Radio 63, KHOW Denver.' DISSOLVE TO interior Halloran's car. Medium close shot. Halloran sitting behind wheel driving along road. Voice over radio continues: 'and, Charlie, we have what you call your bad day out there. What you call your heavy snow, snowing hard throughout the eh Denver metro area. Many of the mountain passes - Wolf Creek, and Red Mountain passes are already closed...' DISSOLVE TO medium shot shooting from behind Halloran through windscreen as he drives, passing overturned truck left. Radio continues: 'and the chain law is in effect right now at the Eisenhower Tunnel... a few of the flights are still landing out at Stapleton International Airport, and, with these early storms like this, I guess the entire airport will probably be closed within the hour... The storm will continue throughout the day, and the national weather service... has declared a stopmans and travelers advisory... for all areas outlying the Denver metro region - get the cows in the barn... Many businesses...'
plotSummary.subtext: Halloran driving through dangerous conditions. Radio emphasizing severity - overturned truck visual proof. Passes closed, airport closing = if he'd waited, couldn't have flown. 'Travelers advisory' = warning against what he's doing. Determination vs. danger.

characterInsights.Hallorann: Driving through treacherous conditions, witnessing overturned truck, undeterred by warnings

supernaturalElements: Halloran driven by psychic call despite rational warnings

scenes.title: INT. OVERLOOK HOTEL - JACK'S APARTMENT - M.S.

plotSummary.brief: INT. OVERLOOK HOTEL - JACK'S APARTMENT - M.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Jack's apartment. Medium shot. Danny and Wendy sitting at table watching TV. Wendy inhales cigarette, looks at her watch, puts cigarette out. 'Hon,' Wendy strokes his hair, takes hold of his chin, turns his face to her. 'listen to me for a minute, will you, hon?' She lowers hand from chin, strokes his hair. 'I'm just going to go and talk to Daddy for a few minutes and I'll be right back. I want you to just stay here and watch your cartoons, okay?' Strokes his hair. 'Okay, hon?' Danny holds up forefinger and wiggles it. TONY: 'Yes, Mrs. Torrance.' Wendy kisses Danny's head. 'All right. Now I'll be back in just about five minutes. I'm gonna lock the door behind me.' She kisses his head, strokes hair, stands up, walks away to door. She stops and picks up a BASEBALL BAT. She walks away through open doorway, exits.
plotSummary.subtext: Wendy preparing to confront Jack about manuscript. Nervous (smoking, checking watch). Telling Danny she'll 'talk to Daddy' = doesn't know what she'll find. plotSummary.brief: INT. HOTEL LOUNGE - M.L.S. / M.S. / M.C.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Hotel lounge. Medium long shot - Wendy holding bat in foreground, turns and walks away to Jack's typewriter on table in background. Medium shot low angle - Jack's typewriter in foreground, Wendy moves forward into shot. She looks down at sheet of paper in typewriter. Medium close shot - Sheet of paper in typewriter with repetition of line: 'ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY.' Sheet turned up showing repetition of line. Again sheet turned up showing repetition. Wendy looking down at typewriter, looks right, moves to right. Sheets of paper filling cardboard box. Camera tracks in on top sheet showing repetition of line 'ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY' filling entire sheet. Low angle - Wendy looking down at box of paper in foreground. She holds up top sheet, looks at it, puts it down in box. Wendy's hand enters frame. She flicks through sheets of paper - sees they are ALL filled with repetition of line: 'ALL WORK AND NO PLAY MAKES JACK A DULL BOY.' Different formats - single-spaced, centered, pyramid patterns, all caps, lowercase. Low angle - Wendy flicking through sheets of paper in box. Horror and realization dawning.
plotSummary.subtext: Jack's 'work' = typing same sentence thousands of times. Complete psychotic break. Different formats show obsessive variations. Hundreds of pages = months of insanity. Wendy's horror - this is what he's been doing instead of writing novel. His mind completely gone.

characterInsights.Jack: Revealed as completely psychotic - months of typing one sentence in obsessive patterns

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL LOUNGE & STAIRS - M.S. (MULTIPLE ANGLES)

plotSummary.brief: INT. HOTEL LOUNGE & STAIRS - M.S. (MULTIPLE ANGLES)
plotSummary.detailed: Hotel lounge and stairs. EXTENSIVE 6-PAGE CONFRONTATION spanning screenplay pages 111-117. Jack interrogates Wendy about Danny. Wendy tentatively suggests Danny should see a doctor. Jack mocks her: 'You think maybe he should be taken to a doctor? When do you think maybe he should be taken to a doctor?' Jack asks 'And are you concerned about me?' then launches into responsibilities rant about his contract with hotel, moral principles, employers' trust. Wendy backs to stairs. Jack follows, asking about his future. Wendy retreats up stairs swinging bat: 'Stay away from me!' Jack: 'Why?' Wendy: 'I just want to go back to my room.' Jack: 'You've had your whole fucking life to think things over - what's good a few minutes more going to do you now?' Wendy: 'Don't hurt me!' Jack reaches toward her: 'Darling, light of my life, I'm not going to hurt you. You didn't let me finish my sentence. I said I'm not going to hurt you... I'm just going to bash your brains in! I'm going to bash them right the fuck in.' Extended back-and-forth as they ascend stairs - Jack repeatedly demanding 'Give me the bat,' Wendy repeatedly crying 'Stay away from me!' Multiple camera angles tracking their movement. Jack reaches up. Wendy hits his hand with bat - he yells 'Goddamn!' Wendy then hits his head. Jack falls backwards down stairs, somersaulting to half landing where he lands facedown. Wendy at top of stairs: 'Oh...oh!' - shocked at what she's done.
plotSummary.subtext: Jack's calm interrogation escalates. 'Maybe taken to doctor' = Jack mocking Wendy's hesitance. Responsibilities rant = Jack prioritizing hotel contract over family safety. 'Concerned about me?' = victimizing himself. Staircase chase = predator pursuing prey. 'Bash your brains in' = murderous intent stated openly with false sweetness ('darling, light of my life'). Repeated 'Give me the bat' = trying to disarm her. Wendy's defense = swinging bat while retreating.

characterInsights.Jack: Interrogating, mocking, ranting about responsibilities, pursuing up stairs, openly threatening murder with false endearments
characterInsights.Wendy: Weeping, backing away, swinging bat, defending self while retreating

Wendy.state: Weeping, backing up stairs, swinging bat defensively, desperate

scenes.significance: ICONIC 6-PAGE CONFRONTATION (screenplay pages 111-117) - Extended staircase chase representing climax of Jack's psychotic transformation. Jack's 'responsibilities' rant prioritizing hotel contract over family safety shows abuser's rhetoric. Escalates to open murder threat: 'Darling, light of my life... I'm just going to bash your brains in!' - false sweetness with murderous intent reveals complete psychosis. Wendy defending with bat while retreating up stairs represents victim fighting back. Classic predator/prey dynamic with shifting camera angles. Repeated exchanges - 'Give me the bat' (Jack ~10 times) / 'Stay away from me' (Wendy ~15 times) - create rhythm of pursuit and defense throughout 6 pages. Culminates in Wendy's defensive strikes: first to Jack's hand, then to his head, causing him to somersault down stairs. Wendy's 'Oh...oh!' shows shock at her own violence, not celebration - this is survival, not vengeance. One of cinema's most famous confrontation scenes, demonstrating Kubrick's mastery of sustained tension.

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL LOUNGE & STAIRS - M.S. / M.L.S.

plotSummary.brief: INT. HOTEL LOUNGE & STAIRS - M.S. / M.L.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Stairs. Jack reaches up with hand. WENDY HITS HIS HAND WITH BAT. SHE SCREAMS. HE YELLS and grabs his wrist. 'Goddamn!' WENDY HITS JACK ON HEAD WITH BAT. Jack throws up hand and leans back. Low angle - Wendy over Jack. He falls backwards down stairs. Camera pans left-right with him as he somersaults down stairs, stopping face down on half landing. High angle - Wendy back to camera at top of stairs, Jack lying facedown on half landing. Wendy: 'Oh...oh!'
plotSummary.subtext: Wendy finally strikes after repeated demands for bat. Jack's hand hit = defensive blow. Head strike = full force self-defense. Jack's fall = tables turned, Wendy victorious. Wendy's 'Oh...oh!' = shock at what she's done, not celebrating violence.

characterInsights.Jack: Reaching for Wendy, struck with bat, falling down stairs unconscious
characterInsights.Wendy: Defending herself with bat, striking Jack, shocked at result

location.description: Interior - Staircase and half landing

keyDialogue.quote: Goddamn!
keyDialogue.speaker: Jack
keyDialogue.significance: Jack's pain/shock as Wendy hits his hand with bat

keyDialogue.quote: Oh...oh!
keyDialogue.speaker: Wendy
keyDialogue.significance: Shock and horror at knocking Jack unconscious down stairs
keyDialogue.context: Looking down at Jack facedown on landing

Jack.state: Reaching for bat, struck, yelling, falling backwards down stairs, unconscious facedown
Jack.arc: Predator becomes victim - knocked unconscious by wife defending herself

Wendy.state: Screaming, striking Jack twice with bat, watching him fall, shocked
Wendy.arc: Victim becomes defender - successfully fights off murderous husband

scenes.significance: CRITICAL TURNING POINT - Wendy strikes Jack with bat. First blow to hand defensive, second blow to head knocks him unconscious. Jack falls backwards down stairs, somersaulting to half landing. Power reversal - murderous husband now vulnerable. Wendy's 'Oh...oh!' shows shock, not triumph. Self-defense successful but horrifying.

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL - KITCHEN & FOOD STORE - M.C.S. / M.S.

plotSummary.brief: Jack laughs and tells Wendy to check the Snowcat; Wendy runs outside to garage
plotSummary.detailed: INT. KITCHEN - M.S.: Wendy by food store door. Jack OFF: 'Go check out the Snowcat and the radio and see what I mean.' He laughs off. 'Go check it out!' INT. FOOD STORE ROOM - M.C.S.: Jack laughing. 'Go check it out!' (repeated twice, laughing). INT. HOTEL - CORRIDOR - M.L.S.: Wendy carrying knife runs forward, camera pans with her as she runs to door and forces it open. EXT. HOTEL - M.L.S.: Wendy forces door open against snow, runs along front of hotel.
plotSummary.subtext: Jack's cruel revelation - he sabotaged their only escape. Laughing maniacally as Wendy discovers the trap. Complete isolation confirmed.

characterInsights.Jack: Unconscious, groaning, coming to, confused, injured ankle, trapped
characterInsights.Wendy: Determined, dragging Jack, locking him in pantry

keyDialogue.quote: Go check it out!
keyDialogue.speaker: Jack
keyDialogue.significance: Jack's repeated mocking command while laughing - enjoying Wendy's impending despair

Jack.arc: Psychotic triumph - trapped but gloating over having destroyed Wendy's escape plan

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL - KITCHEN & GARAGE - M.S. / BLACK FRAMES

plotSummary.brief: Wendy discovers damaged Snowcat in garage; BLACK FRAMES with '4 p.m.' time card
plotSummary.detailed: INT. HOTEL - GARAGE - M.S.: Snowcat in garage. Wendy seen through open doorway. She runs forward and enters garage, carrying knife. She stops at entrance. Then she moves toward Snowcat, and picks up distributor cap. CAMERA TRACKS IN on her, reacting to damaged distributor cap. CUT TO: BLACK FRAMES. Superimposed: '4 p.m.' CUT TO: EXT. HOTEL - L.S.: Overlook Hotel in background. Snow and trees in foreground.
plotSummary.subtext: Wendy's hope shattered - Snowcat disabled, escape impossible. Time card '4 p.m.' marks passage of time, Jack still locked in pantry.

location.description: Interior - Hotel garage with disabled Snowcat; Exterior - Long shot of Overlook Hotel in snow

Jack.state: Locked in pantry (not present in scene)
Jack.arc: His sabotage discovered - Wendy now knows she's trapped

scenes.significance: DEVASTATING DISCOVERY - Wendy finds damaged Snowcat distributor cap, confirming Jack's sabotage. Silent scene - her reaction says everything. BLACK FRAMES with '4 p.m.' time card shows hours passing. Escape impossible, family trapped with murderous father.

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL - FOOD STORE & HALLORAN'S SNOWCAT - M.C.S.

plotSummary.brief: INT. HOTEL - FOOD STORE & HALLORAN'S SNOWCAT - M.C.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Food store. Jack asleep on sacks. KNOCK ON DOOR. Jack stirs, sits up. Grady: 'It's Grady, Mr. Torrance. Delbert Grady.' Conversation through door. Grady criticizes Jack for failing to 'take care of the business we discussed.' Jack promises to deal with situation. Grady doubts his commitment: 'I and others believe your heart is not in this.' Jack asks for one more chance. Grady notes Wendy 'got the better of you,' calls for 'harshest possible way.' Jack pledges: 'Nothing I look forward to with greater pleasure.' Sound of bolt being drawn, handle unfastened. Intercut: Halloran driving Snowcat through night storm.
plotSummary.subtext: Hotel's judgment on Jack's failure. Grady as spokesman for malevolent forces. Jack promising murder to regain favor. Liberation conditional on commitment to violence.

supernaturalElements: Grady's ghost appearing to locked-in Jack
Hotel speaking through Grady - collective evil ('I and others')
Door supernaturally unlocked by ghost - bolt drawn without physical presence

location.primary: HOTEL - FOOD STORE ROOM & HALLORAN'S SNOWCAT
location.description: Interior - Food store room with Jack locked in, intercut with Halloran driving snowcat through night storm on snow-covered roads

keyDialogue.quote: It's Grady, Mr. Torrance. Delbert Grady.
keyDialogue.speaker: Grady (OFF)
keyDialogue.significance: CRITICAL - The ghost butler reveals himself, come to judge Jack's failure
keyDialogue.context: Grady knocking on locked pantry door where Jack is imprisoned

keyDialogue.quote: Mr. Torrance, I see you can hardly have taken care of the business we discussed.
keyDialogue.speaker: Grady (OFF)
keyDialogue.significance: Grady criticizes Jack for failing to kill his family as promised
keyDialogue.context: Through locked door, judging Jack's imprisonment

keyDialogue.quote: No need to rub it in, Mr. Grady. I'll deal with that situation as soon as I get out of here.
keyDialogue.speaker: Jack
keyDialogue.significance: Jack defensive, still committed to murder despite being locked up

keyDialogue.quote: Will you indeed, Mr. Torrance. I wonder. I have my doubts.
keyDialogue.speaker: Grady (OFF)
keyDialogue.significance: Grady doubting Jack's commitment, applying psychological pressure

keyDialogue.quote: I and others have come to believe... that your heart is not in this, that you haven't the belly for it.
keyDialogue.speaker: Grady (OFF)
keyDialogue.significance: ICONIC LINE - Hotel's judgment: Jack lacks commitment to violence, questioning his worth

keyDialogue.quote: Just give me one more chance to prove it, Mr. Grady. That's all I ask.
keyDialogue.speaker: Jack
keyDialogue.significance: Jack begging for redemption from evil forces - desperate to prove murderous commitment

keyDialogue.quote: Your wife appears to be stronger than we imagined, Mr. Torrance. Somewhat more resourceful, she seems to have got the better of you.
keyDialogue.speaker: Grady (OFF)
keyDialogue.significance: Grady mocking Jack - emasculating him, Wendy defeated him

keyDialogue.quote: For the moment, Mr. Grady. Only for the moment.
keyDialogue.speaker: Jack
keyDialogue.significance: Jack's pride wounded, swearing revenge against Wendy

keyDialogue.quote: I fear that you will have to deal with this matter in the harshest possible way, Mr. Torrance. I fear that is the only thing to do.
keyDialogue.speaker: Grady (OFF)
keyDialogue.significance: CRITICAL - Explicit order to murder wife and child in 'harshest possible way'
keyDialogue.context: Hotel demanding brutal family murder as price of liberation

keyDialogue.quote: There's nothing I look forward to with the greater pleasure, Mr. Grady.
keyDialogue.speaker: Jack
keyDialogue.significance: CHILLING - Jack pledging to murder his family with pleasure, fully possessed by evil

keyDialogue.quote: You give your word on that do you, Mr. Torrance?
keyDialogue.speaker: Grady (OFF)
keyDialogue.significance: Grady demanding binding oath of murder

keyDialogue.quote: I give you my word.
keyDialogue.speaker: Jack
keyDialogue.significance: Jack's solemn vow to brutally murder Wendy and Danny - deal with devil complete
keyDialogue.context: Jack nodding head, giving word. Followed by SOUND OF BOLT BEING DRAWN

Jack.state: Locked in pantry, desperate, making pact with supernatural forces to escape and murder family
Jack.arc: CRITICAL TURNING POINT - Judged and found wanting by hotel, must prove commitment by promising brutal murder. Gives his word to kill Wendy and Danny. Door unlocked by Grady as reward.

Grady.state: Ghost speaking through door, judging Jack's failure, demanding murder oath
Grady.arc: Hotel's spokesman delivering judgment and terms: brutal family murder required for liberation

Halloran.state: Intercut scenes - driving snowcat through night storm toward hotel
Halloran.arc: Rescue mission progressing through treacherous conditions while Jack makes murder pact

scenes.significance: PIVOTAL SUPERNATURAL SCENE - Jack makes explicit pact with hotel's evil forces. Grady (speaking for 'I and others') judges Jack's failure, questions his commitment, demands proof. Jack vows to murder Wendy and Danny 'in the harshest possible way' with 'greater pleasure.' Upon giving his word, door supernaturally unlocks. Devil's bargain complete. Intercut with Halloran's rescue attempt creates dramatic irony.

plotSummary.detailed: Exterior road at night. Halloran driving Snowcat forward along snow-covered road between trees. DISSOLVE. Interior Snowcat - Halloran driving. DISSOLVE. Shooting from behind Halloran through windscreen with wipers working, moving forward along snow-covered road. Trees on either side. Halloran making dangerous journey through storm to reach hotel.

Halloran.arc: Heroic rescue journey continuing - pushing through dangerous blizzard conditions to reach hotel and save Danny/Wendy

Three dissolving shots show his progress: exterior road through trees, interior driving view, behind-shoulder windscreen shot with wipers. Silent determination. Intercutting with Jack's liberation by Grady creates dramatic irony - hero approaching as villain freed. Race against time.

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL - JACK'S APARTMENT - M.C.S.

plotSummary.detailed: Jack's apartment at night. Danny moves toward Wendy asleep in bed. Tony's voice repeatedly: 'Red Rum.' Danny stops beside bed. Reaches for knife on table. Holds up knife, feels blade. Turns away, walks to dressing table. Picks up lipstick. Tony's voice continues 'Red Rum' throughout. Danny walks to door carrying knife and lipstick. Begins writing word 'MURDER' in reverse on door. Danny in deep trance, Tony controlling actions.
plotSummary.subtext: Danny in deepest trance, completely controlled by Tony. Psychic warning manifesting physically. REDRUM/MURDER message for Wendy.

supernaturalElements: Deep trance state - Danny as psychic vessel
Preparation for REDRUM message (MURDER spelled backwards)

location.description: Interior - Jack's apartment at night, Danny in trance, Wendy asleep in bed

keyDialogue.quote: Red Rum. Red Rum. Red Rum. Red Rum.
keyDialogue.speaker: Tony's Voice
keyDialogue.significance: ICONIC - Tony's voice repeating 'Red Rum' throughout scene, controlling Danny's actions

keyDialogue.speaker: Tony's Voice
keyDialogue.significance: Continuing mantra as Danny reaches for knife
keyDialogue.context: Danny at bedside table picking up knife

keyDialogue.speaker: Tony's Voice
keyDialogue.significance: Voice continuing as Danny examines knife blade

keyDialogue.speaker: Tony's Voice

Wendy.arc: Sleeping through Danny's possession, about to receive psychic warning message

Tony.arc: Tony's power at maximum - using Danny to deliver warning about Jack's murder intent

scenes.significance: CRITICAL SUPERNATURAL SCENE - Danny in deepest trance, completely controlled by Tony's repeated 'Red Rum' mantra. Picks up knife and lipstick while Wendy sleeps. Tony using Danny as vessel to deliver psychic warning. Scene is almost entirely Tony's voice repeating 'Red Rum' (MURDER backwards) as Danny mechanically gathers tools to write message. Eerie, hypnotic sequence showing Danny's psychic power at maximum.

scenes.title: INT. OVERLOOK HOTEL - JACK'S APARTMENT - M.S.

plotSummary.brief: INT. OVERLOOK HOTEL - JACK'S APARTMENT - M.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Jack's apartment. Danny at door holding knife and lipstick, Wendy asleep in background. Tony's voice repeating 'Red Rum.' Danny writes word 'MURDER' in reverse on door with lipstick. Finishes writing, looks at word. Turns and walks toward sleeping Wendy. Wendy wakes with shriek. Danny beside her repeating 'Red Rum.' Wendy takes knife away, tells him to stop. Pulls Danny toward her, looks over his shoulder. Reacts - camera zooms in on her face.
plotSummary.subtext: Danny's psychic warning complete. Message written for Wendy to see in mirror. Wendy discovering both message and freed Jack imminent.

supernaturalElements: Tony's voice guiding Danny to write MURDER backwards
Danny writing in reverse - REDRUM on door will read MURDER in mirror
Danny speaking 'Red Rum' while in trance state
Psychic message for Wendy to decode

scenes.title: INT. JACK'S APARTMENT & CORRIDOR - M.S. / M.C.S.

plotSummary.brief: INT. JACK'S APARTMENT & CORRIDOR - M.S. / M.C.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Wendy's POV - word 'MURDER' written on door reflected in mirror. Camera zooms in on word. SOUND OF AXE STRIKING DOOR. Wendy shrieks, holds Danny. Jack swings axe at apartment front door. Wendy holding Danny gets up off bed. Jack continues chopping door. Wendy with Danny moves to door with MURDER written on it, opens it, goes into bathroom, closes and locks door. Jack swings axe, splinters panel. Wendy and Danny move to bathroom window.
plotSummary.subtext: REDRUM/MURDER revealed in mirror. Jack freed from pantry attacking with axe. Wendy and Danny trapped in bathroom. Iconic horror sequence beginning.

supernaturalElements: REDRUM message decoded - mirror reveals MURDER
Danny's psychic warning realized by Wendy

location.description: Interior - Jack's apartment with mirror reflecting MURDER message, corridor with Jack swinging axe, bathroom where Wendy and Danny flee

Wendy.state: Seeing MURDER reflected in mirror, shrieking, grabbing Danny, fleeing to bathroom, locking door, moving to window
Wendy.arc: CRITICAL REALIZATION - Sees REDRUM as MURDER in mirror, realizes Jack's intent. Terror and survival instinct activated. Flees with Danny to bathroom as Jack axes through apartment door.

Danny.state: Held by Wendy as she flees to bathroom, clinging to her in terror
Danny.arc: Rescued by mother, carried to bathroom safety while Jack attacks with axe

Jack.state: Freed from pantry, attacking apartment door with axe, splintering panels
Jack.arc: MURDEROUS RAMPAGE BEGINS - Jack attacking with axe to reach Wendy and Danny. First door assault. Methodically chopping through to kill his family.

scenes.significance: ICONIC REVELATION SCENE - Wendy sees REDRUM reflected as MURDER in mirror. Camera zooms on word. SOUND OF AXE STRIKING DOOR. Shrieking, Wendy grabs Danny and flees. Rapid intercutting: Jack swinging axe at apartment door / Wendy getting up / Jack chopping door / Wendy fleeing to bathroom door (with MURDER written on it) / Locks bathroom door / Jack splintering panel / Wendy and Danny moving to window. NO DIALOGUE - purely visual terror with sound effects. Danny's psychic warning fulfilled. Bathroom siege begins.

plotSummary.brief: INT. BATHROOM & CORRIDOR - M.S. / EXT. HOTEL - M.S.
plotSummary.detailed: Bathroom. Wendy unbolts window, raises bottom part. Tries to force window higher. Danny hears axe splintering door. Jack swings axe at door. Wendy looking out window, draws back. Jack pulls wood from splintered panel, looks through gap. Wendy lifts Danny to window. Pushes Danny out onto snow, he slides down. Window too small for Wendy - she struggles to get out, cannot fit. Jack walking through apartment with axe.
plotSummary.subtext: Danny escapes through window but Wendy trapped - window too small for adult. Mother saves child but cannot save herself. Jack approaching.

location.description: Interior - Bathroom with Wendy and Danny at window, corridor with Jack swinging axe, apartment with Jack pulling wood from door panel; Exterior - Hotel with bathroom window and snow slope

keyDialogue.quote: Wendy, I'm home.
keyDialogue.speaker: Jack
keyDialogue.significance: ICONIC LINE - Jack's sinister greeting as he looks through gap in splintered door panel, mockery of domestic normalcy while attempting murder
keyDialogue.context: Jack at gap in splintered apartment door panel, looking through at Wendy and Danny

Wendy.state: Trying to force window higher, looking out, drawing back, lifting Danny to window, pushing Danny out onto snow, struggling to fit through window herself - CANNOT ESCAPE
Wendy.arc: MOTHER'S SACRIFICE - Successfully pushes Danny out window to safety but window too small for her to escape. Trapped. Danny saved, Wendy doomed.

Danny.state: Clinging to Wendy in bathroom, hearing axe splintering door, lifted to window, pushed out onto snow, sliding down, standing up, looking up at trapped Wendy
Danny.arc: ESCAPED - Mother sacrifices own escape to save him. Now outside, safe but helpless, watching mother trapped.

Jack.state: Swinging axe at door, pulling wood from splintered panel, looking through gap, saying 'Wendy, I'm home,' unlocking door, walking through apartment with axe
Jack.arc: METHODICAL KILLER - Breaking through door, mocking greeting through gap, unlocking door from inside. Hunting family with axe. About to enter apartment.

scenes.significance: CRITICAL ESCAPE/TRAP SCENE - Rapid intercutting creates unbearable tension. Wendy forces window open, Danny hears axe. Jack swinging at door. Wendy looks out window. Jack pulls wood from splintered panel, looks through gap: 'Wendy, I'm home' (ICONIC LINE - domestic greeting while murdering). Jack unlocks door. Wendy pushes Danny out window onto snow - he slides down safely. Wendy tries to escape but WINDOW TOO SMALL - cannot fit. Jack walking through apartment with axe. Danny escaped but Wendy trapped. Mother saved child but doomed herself. Heartbreaking visual storytelling.

scenes.title: INT. BEDROOM & BATHROOM - M.S. / M.C.S. / EXT. HOTEL - M.S.

plotSummary.brief: Jack unlocks door; Wendy pushes Danny out window but cannot fit herself; Jack enters bedroom
plotSummary.detailed: Jack reaches through gap in splintered door panel, unlocks apartment door. INT. BATHROOM - Wendy lifts Danny to open window. EXT. HOTEL - Wendy pushes Danny out through window onto snow. He slides down, stands up, looks up at Wendy. Wendy struggles to get out of window - CANNOT FIT. Jack carrying axe moves up stairs from open front door. Wendy struggling, goes back into bathroom. Danny looking up at window. Jack walks across living room into bedroom carrying axe: 'Come out, come out, wherever you are!'
plotSummary.subtext: Danny successfully pushed to safety. Wendy trapped - window too small. Jack freed, hunting them with axe. Fairy tale hide-and-seek turned murderous.

location.description: Interior - Bedroom with Jack at bathroom door, bathroom with Wendy trapped; Exterior - Hotel showing Wendy at window calling to Danny below on snow

keyDialogue.quote: Come out, come out, wherever you are!
keyDialogue.speaker: Jack
keyDialogue.significance: ICONIC - Jack playfully calling as if playing hide-and-seek with child, but carrying axe to murder family
keyDialogue.context: Jack walking into bedroom carrying axe, hunting for Wendy and Danny

Wendy.state: Lifting Danny to window, pushing him out to safety, struggling to fit through window herself - TRAPPED, going back into bathroom
Wendy.arc: Successfully saves Danny but cannot save herself - window too small for adult. Mother's sacrifice complete.

Danny.state: Pushed out window by Wendy, sliding down snow, standing up, looking up at trapped mother
Danny.arc: SAFE outside but watching helplessly as mother remains trapped inside with murderous father

Jack.state: Unlocking door, carrying axe through apartment, walking into bedroom, playfully calling 'Come out, come out, wherever you are'
Jack.arc: FREED from pantry. Hunting family with axe. Playful hide-and-seek tone makes it more chilling.

scenes.significance: CRITICAL ESCAPE SCENE - Jack unlocks apartment door. Wendy successfully pushes Danny out bathroom window onto snow. Danny slides down safely. Wendy struggles desperately to fit through window but CANNOT ESCAPE - window too small for adult. Goes back into bathroom. Danny outside looking up helplessly. Jack enters bedroom carrying axe, calling in playful hide-and-seek voice: 'Come out, come out, wherever you are!' - chilling contrast between playful tone and murderous intent. Danny saved, Wendy doomed.

scenes.title: EXT. HOTEL - M.S. / INT. BEDROOM - M.C.S.

plotSummary.brief: Wendy tells Danny to run; Jack begins fairy tale threat at bathroom door
plotSummary.detailed: EXT: L.S. Wendy at bathroom window calling to Danny at foot of snow slope below. She tells him 'Run, run and hide. Run, quick!' Danny runs away. CUT TO: INT BEDROOM - M.C.S. Jack at bathroom door begins fairy tale threat: 'Little pigs, little pigs, let me come in!' CUT TO: INT BATHROOM - Wendy moves from open window to basin, picks up knife, positions herself at side of door with weapon ready.
plotSummary.subtext: Wendy sacrificing herself - sends Danny to safety while she faces Jack alone with only a knife against his axe

characterInsights.Wendy: Mother's instinct - saves child first, arms herself second. Knows she can't escape through window.
characterInsights.Danny: Obeys mother's command, runs to safety alone in freezing night
characterInsights.Jack: Fairy tale references - mocking domesticity, playful menace before violence

location.description: Exterior hotel showing Wendy at bathroom window with Danny below on snow; Interior bedroom with Jack at bathroom door; Interior bathroom with Wendy arming herself

keyDialogue.quote: Danny, I can't get out!
keyDialogue.speaker: Wendy
keyDialogue.significance: Wendy realizes she's trapped - window too small for her escape
keyDialogue.context: Calling to Danny from bathroom window

keyDialogue.quote: Run, run and hide. Run, quick!
keyDialogue.speaker: Wendy
keyDialogue.significance: Mother's urgent command - prioritizing Danny's survival over her own
keyDialogue.context: Telling Danny to flee while she faces Jack

keyDialogue.quote: Little pigs, little pigs, let me come in!
keyDialogue.speaker: Jack
keyDialogue.significance: ICONIC LINE - Jack begins Three Little Pigs fairy tale, perverting children's story into murder threat
keyDialogue.context: Jack at bathroom door, beginning his assault

Wendy.state: Trapped but armed, sending Danny to safety
Wendy.arc: Mother protecting child - accepts she cannot escape, focuses on Danny's survival

Danny.arc: Child forced to run from homicidal father into freezing darkness

Jack.state: Psychotic, playfully menacing with fairy tale threats
Jack.arc: Complete break with reality - treating murder as children's game

scenes.significance: CRITICAL SCENE - Wendy trapped, sends Danny to safety. Jack begins iconic fairy tale threat. Final family separation before climax.

scenes.title: INT. BEDROOM - M.C.S. / M.S. / INT. BATHROOM - M.S.

plotSummary.brief: Jack completes fairy tale threat and begins axing through bathroom door; Wendy pleads
plotSummary.detailed: INT. BEDROOM - M.C.S.: Jack at bathroom door completes Three Little Pigs rhyme: 'Not by the hair on your chiny, chin, chin. Then I'll huff, and I'll puff...' M.S.: Jack holds axe back to camera at door: '...and I'll blow your house in.' He swings axe back. M.S.: Jack swings axe TWICE at bathroom door. WENDY SCREAMS OFF. INT. BATHROOM - M.S.: Wendy standing at side of door. Jack's axe appears through door repeatedly, splintering it. Wendy screams. 'Jack. Please. Don't... Don't...' Head of axe appears through splintered door. Wendy screams 'Don't! Oh! Please...' Head of axe appears again. 'Stop!' M.C.S. Splintered door panel. Wendy OFF: 'Jack!'
plotSummary.subtext: Jack's playful fairy tale becomes horrifying reality - literal axe-murderer 'huffing and puffing' to break through door. Wendy begging for mercy.

characterInsights.Jack: Fairy tale becomes literal - domestic father figure transformed into Big Bad Wolf with axe
characterInsights.Wendy: Pleading with Jack's humanity while knowing he's gone - begging name of man no longer there

location.description: Interior bedroom with Jack wielding axe; Interior bathroom with Wendy trapped as door splinters

keyDialogue.quote: Not by the hair on your chiny, chin, chin. Then I'll huff, and I'll puff and I'll blow your house in.
keyDialogue.speaker: Jack
keyDialogue.significance: ICONIC COMPLETION - Jack finishes Three Little Pigs fairy tale before literal axe assault on 'house' (door)
keyDialogue.context: Jack at bathroom door, completing fairy tale threat before swinging axe

keyDialogue.quote: Jack. Please. Don't... Don't... Don't! Oh! Please... Stop! Jack!
keyDialogue.speaker: Wendy
keyDialogue.significance: Wendy's desperate pleas - repeating Jack's name, begging for mercy as axe smashes through door
keyDialogue.context: Wendy's terror as axe repeatedly appears through bathroom door, splintering it

Wendy.state: Terrified, begging for mercy, trapped with knife as only defense
Wendy.arc: Victim pleading with abuser's name - hoping humanity remains in monster attacking her

Jack.state: Methodically destroying door with axe, completing playful fairy tale threat
Jack.arc: Psychotic joy in violence - fairy tale wolf literally huffing/puffing house down

scenes.significance: PIVOTAL HORROR SCENE - Jack's fairy tale threat becomes literal axe assault. Bathroom door splintering - barrier between Wendy and death breaking down.

discussionQuestions.question: How does Jack's psychological deterioration unfold across the film's structure, and what early warning signs appear before his complete breakdown?

scenes.title: INT. BEDROOM & BATHROOM - M.C.S. / M.S.

plotSummary.brief: "HERE'S JOHNNY!" - Jack's face appears through splintered door, Wendy slashes his hand with knife
plotSummary.detailed: Jack swings axe, smashes away splintered wood. Wendy OFF: 'Stop it! Stop it!' INT. BEDROOM - M.S.: Jack swings axe at splintered door. Wendy OFF: 'Stop it!' Jack moves to gap in splintered door. WENDY SCREAMS OFF. INT. BATHROOM - M.C.S.: JACK'S FACE AT GAP IN SPLINTERED DOOR. 'Here's Johnny!' M.C.S.: Wendy holding knife SCREAMS. M.C.S.: Jack's smiling face at gap - he moves backwards and reaches hand through gap. M.C.S.: Jack's hand reaching through gap to key on inside of door. M.S.: WENDY STRIKES DOWN WITH KNIFE. M.C.S.: Jack's hand on key - WENDY'S KNIFE SLASHES ACROSS BACK OF HIS HAND and withdraws. Jack's hand moves to gap in door. JACK YELLS OFF.
plotSummary.subtext: MOST ICONIC MOMENT IN FILM - Jack's grinning face through splintered door. Johnny Carson reference becomes ultimate horror image. Wendy finally fights back successfully, slashing Jack's hand.

characterInsights.Jack: Smiling, playful even while murdering - psychotic joy, Johnny Carson impression during murder attempt
characterInsights.Wendy: Switches from begging to action - successfully defends herself with knife slash

location.description: Splintered bathroom door with gap; Jack's face appearing through hole; Wendy defending with knife

keyDialogue.quote: Here's Johnny!
keyDialogue.speaker: Jack
keyDialogue.significance: MOST ICONIC LINE IN HORROR CINEMA - Jack improvised Johnny Carson reference, grinning face through splintered door became cultural touchstone
keyDialogue.context: Jack's smiling face appears at gap in splintered bathroom door

keyDialogue.quote: Stop it! Stop it!
keyDialogue.speaker: Wendy (OFF)
keyDialogue.significance: Wendy's final desperate pleas before Jack breaks through completely
keyDialogue.context: As Jack smashes final pieces of bathroom door

Wendy.state: Screaming in terror, then successfully slashing Jack's hand with knife
Wendy.arc: From begging victim to effective defender - wounds Jack, stops his door unlocking

Jack.state: Grinning psychotically, making Johnny Carson joke while attempting murder, then yelling in pain
Jack.arc: Playful murderer wounded by victim - Jack experiences consequence, forced to retreat momentarily

scenes.significance: MOST ICONIC SCENE IN FILM - 'Here's Johnny!' became defining horror image. Jack Nicholson's improvised line and grinning face through splintered door = cultural phenomenon. Wendy successfully wounds Jack - first time she physically stops him.

scenes.title: EXT. ROAD - NIGHT / INT. BATHROOM / INT. BEDROOM / EXT. HOTEL - NIGHT

plotSummary.brief: Halloran's snowcat approaches hotel - both Jack and Wendy hear it
plotSummary.detailed: M.C.S.: Jack's face at gap in door, YELLING, looks down and turns away. EXT. ROAD - NIGHT - M.S.: Shooting from behind Halloran sitting back to camera in snowcat, driving along snow-covered road. INT. BATHROOM - M.S.: Wendy at side of door looks cam.R as she HEARS HALLORAN'S SNOWCAT APPROACHING OFF. INT. BEDROOM - M.C.S.: Jack at bathroom door turns round as he HEARS HALLORAN'S SNOWCAT APPROACHING OFF. He looks down cam.L. EXT. HOTEL - NIGHT - L.S.: Halloran's snowcat moves R-L along snow-covered road. CAMERA TRACKS with it revealing Overlook Hotel in b.g. INT. BEDROOM - M.C.S.: Jack looking cam.R, turns away to splintered door. SOUND OF SNOWCAT OFF. INT. BATHROOM - M.C.S.: Wendy at side of door listening. EXT. HOTEL - L.S.: Halloran's snowcat moves R-L along front of hotel. CAMERA TRACKS with it. Snowcat stops.
plotSummary.subtext: Rescue arrives - both predator and prey hear it. Jack's murder attempt interrupted. Wendy's hope vs. Jack's new target.

characterInsights.Halloran: Heroically arriving through blizzard to save Danny and Wendy
characterInsights.Wendy: Hears snowcat - potential rescue, moment of hope in terror
characterInsights.Jack: Distracted from Wendy by new sound - calculating new threat

location.primary: MULTIPLE - ROAD, BATHROOM, BEDROOM, EXT. HOTEL
location.description: Intercutting between Halloran driving snowcat on road, Wendy trapped in bathroom hearing rescue, Jack at bathroom door hearing interruption, exterior shots of hotel with approaching snowcat

Halloran.state: Driving snowcat through blizzard, approaching hotel to rescue Danny and Wendy
Halloran.arc: Heroic journey complete - arrived at Overlook despite treacherous conditions

Wendy.state: Trapped in bathroom, wounded Jack's hand, now hears approaching snowcat - hope
Wendy.arc: From terror to hearing rescue - potential salvation arriving

Jack.state: Wounded hand, interrupted bathroom assault by snowcat sound, new focus
Jack.arc: Distracted from Wendy murder by Halloran's arrival - calculating response to intruder

scenes.significance: CRITICAL TURNING POINT - Halloran's rescue attempt interrupts Jack's murder of Wendy. Both hear snowcat. Jack forced to abandon bathroom assault. Intercutting creates suspense - will Halloran save them or become another victim?

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR - KITCHEN / INT. BATHROOM / EXT. HOTEL

plotSummary.brief: Danny hides in kitchen oven; Jack limps through kitchen with axe; Wendy trapped in bathroom; Halloran enters hotel
plotSummary.detailed: INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR - KITCHEN - M.L.S.: Danny runs forward along corridor. CAMERA TRACKS BACK before him. He runs into kitchen - stops and moves L-R to oven. He kneels down beside it. CAMERA PANS with him. Danny slides oven door open R-L and crawls into it. M.C.S.: Danny in oven slides door R-L. M.S.: Oven door sliding L-R. M.S.: JACK HOLDING AXE LIMPS R-L THROUGH KITCHEN. CAMERA TRACKS with him. INT. BATHROOM - M.S.: Wendy sobbing at side of door - then she moves to door and slashes at it with knife. EXT. HOTEL - M.L.S.: Halloran walking R-L. CAMERA TRACKS with him. He moves to door left open by Wendy. He pulls it open wide and exits into hotel. INT. HOTEL - LOBBY - M.S.: Jack holding axe moves forward - CAMERA PANS R-L and TRACKS with him. He moves away up stairs. HALLORAN OFF: 'Hallo!' Jack at top of stairs. HALLORAN OFF: 'Anybody here?' Jack moves away from stairs, CAMERA TRACKS after him. Jack moves R-L and looks down at lobby.
plotSummary.subtext: Danny cleverly hides in oven. Jack hunts through kitchen unaware Danny is feet away. Halloran unknowingly enters death trap. Jack positions for ambush.

characterInsights.Danny: Quick thinking - hides in oven, clever survival instinct
characterInsights.Jack: Limping from Wendy's knife wound, hunting with axe, hears Halloran and sets up ambush
characterInsights.Halloran: Calling out innocently, unaware Jack waits with axe
characterInsights.Wendy: Still trapped in bathroom, trying to break through door with knife

location.primary: MULTIPLE - KITCHEN CORRIDOR, BATHROOM, EXT. HOTEL, LOBBY
location.description: Intercutting: Kitchen with Danny hiding in oven and Jack limping through with axe; Bathroom with Wendy trapped; Exterior with Halloran entering; Lobby with Jack positioning for ambush

keyDialogue.quote: Hallo!
keyDialogue.speaker: Halloran (OFF)
keyDialogue.significance: Halloran's innocent greeting - alerting Jack to his presence, sealing his fate
keyDialogue.context: Halloran entering hotel lobby calling out

keyDialogue.quote: Anybody here?
keyDialogue.speaker: Halloran (OFF)
keyDialogue.significance: Tragic irony - Jack IS here, waiting with axe to kill him
keyDialogue.context: Halloran continuing to call out, unaware of danger

Danny.state: Hiding in kitchen oven, evading Jack
Danny.arc: Clever child survival - using environment to hide from murderous father

Jack.state: Limping from knife wound, hunting with axe, hears Halloran and positions for ambush at top of stairs
Jack.arc: Wounded predator switching targets from Wendy to Halloran - setting lethal trap

Halloran.state: Entering hotel calling out innocently, unaware of danger
Halloran.arc: Hero walking into trap - his calls alerting murderer to his location

Wendy.state: Still trapped in bathroom, trying to break through door with knife
Wendy.arc: Isolated from action - unaware Halloran has arrived

scenes.significance: CRITICAL CONVERGENCE SCENE - Four storylines intercutting: Danny hiding inches from Jack in oven, Jack hunting through kitchen, Wendy trapped in bathroom, Halloran entering lobby innocently. Dramatic irony - audience knows Jack waits with axe while Halloran calls out. Jack positions at top of stairs for ambush. Masterful intercutting builds unbearable tension.

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL - LOBBY - M.L.S. / M.S. / M.C.S.

plotSummary.brief: Jack ambushes and kills Halloran with axe in hotel lobby; Danny psychically witnesses the murder
plotSummary.detailed: M.L.S.: Halloran moves forward along corridor. CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD. HALLORAN: 'Hallo!' Halloran moves R-L to entrance to lobby. 'Anybody here?' Halloran moves away into lobby. CAMERA TRACKS FORWARD after him. 'Hallo! Hallo! Anybody here?' JACK, HOLDING AXE, YELLS AS HE STEPS FROM BEHIND PILLAR CAM.R AND MOVES TOWARDS HALLORAN. M.S.: JACK YELLING AS HE SWINGS AXE AT HALLORAN. M.C.S.: HALLORAN'S CHEST - AXE PIERCES RAINCOAT AND BLOOD OOZES OUT. M.C.S.: DANNY, WITH HIS MOUTH WIDE OPEN. M.S.: Jack over Halloran. Jack holding onto shaft of axe. M.C.S.: Halloran, with his mouth wide open. M.C.S.: DANNY, with his mouth wide open.
plotSummary.subtext: Halloran's heroic rescue ends in brutal murder. Danny psychically connected - experiences Halloran's death through intercutting. Hope extinguished. Jack eliminates outside help.

characterInsights.Jack: Ambush predator - patient, hidden, explosive violence when Halloran vulnerable
characterInsights.Halloran: Dies calling out innocently - heroic journey ends in instant death
characterInsights.Danny: Psychically witnesses Halloran's murder through the shining - traumatized, helpless

supernaturalElements: Danny's psychic vision of Halloran's death

location.description: Hotel lobby with Jack hiding behind pillar, Halloran entering calling out, intercutting with Danny's psychic vision of the murder

keyDialogue.quote: Hallo! Anybody here? Hallo! Hallo! Anybody here?
keyDialogue.speaker: Halloran
keyDialogue.significance: Halloran's final innocent words - calling out for Danny and Wendy seconds before Jack kills him
keyDialogue.context: Halloran entering lobby, unaware Jack waits with axe behind pillar

Halloran.state: Calling out innocently, then axe to chest - instant death
Halloran.arc: DEATH - Heroic rescue attempt ends in brutal ambush murder. Traveled through blizzard to save Danny and Wendy, killed immediately upon entry. Tragic hero.

Jack.state: Hidden predator executing perfect ambush with axe, yelling as he strikes
Jack.arc: Patient hunter - waited silently for Halloran to enter kill zone, explosive violence, eliminates outside help

Danny.state: Psychically witnessing Halloran's death - mouth wide open in horror, experiencing murder through shining
Danny.arc: Traumatized by psychic connection - experiences Halloran dying, knows rescue failed

scenes.significance: DEVASTATING SCENE - Halloran's heroic rescue ends in instant brutal death. Jack's perfect ambush from behind pillar. Danny psychically witnesses murder through the shining - intercutting Danny's open mouth with Halloran's creates powerful psychic connection. Hope extinguished. Only help from outside world eliminated. Wendy and Danny completely isolated now.

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL - LOBBY / KITCHEN / STAIRS - M.L.S. / M.S.

plotSummary.brief: Intercutting continues: Halloran dying, Jack rising; Jack calls for Danny; Danny escapes from oven; Wendy runs up stairs
plotSummary.detailed: M.S.: Jack over Halloran, holding onto shaft of axe. M.C.S.: Halloran, with his mouth wide open, sinks down out of shot. M.C.S.: DANNY, with his mouth wide open. M.C.S.: JACK RISES UP INTO SHOT. M.L.S.: Jack holding axe standing beside body of Halloran on floor. Jack limps forward. CAMERA TRACKS BACK before him. JACK: 'Danny! Danny boy!' He stops at corridor to kitchen. 'Danny!' M.L.S.: Jack back to camera in R.f.g. DANNY CLIMBS OUT OF OVEN IN B.G. Jack moves forward. DANNY EXITS CAM.R.F.G. Jack limps away. CAMERA TRACKS IN after him. 'Danny! Danny!' INT. HOTEL - STAIRS - M.S.: High Angle WENDY runs up stairs L-R. She pauses on landing. WENDY: 'Danny!' CAMERA TRACKS BACK before Wendy as she goes up next flight of stairs. She stops at top of stairs and looks along landing. M.L.S.: WENDY'S P.O.V. Shooting along landing into open doorway of bedroom.
plotSummary.subtext: Intercutting completes Halloran's death sequence. Danny narrowly escapes - climbs out of oven just as Jack enters kitchen. Three family members separated, searching. Danny fleeing, Wendy searching, Jack hunting.

characterInsights.Danny: Perfect timing escape - leaves oven just as Jack turns away, clever survival
characterInsights.Jack: Hunting Danny through hotel, calling his name like twisted game of hide-and-seek
characterInsights.Wendy: Escaped bathroom, desperately searching for Danny, unaware of Halloran's death below

Three-way separation: Danny fleeing, Jack hunting, Wendy searching. Family completely fractured. Jack's false endearments ('Danny boy') while wielding murder weapon. Wendy about to encounter supernatural horror on landing.

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL - LANDING / BEDROOM - M.L.S. / M.S.

plotSummary.brief: Wendy sees man in dog costume performing sex act on man in evening dress - backs away in horror
plotSummary.detailed: M.L.S.: WENDY'S P.O.V. Shooting along landing into open doorway of bedroom. MAN, DRESSED IN DOG'S COSTUME, KNEELING AT FOOT OF BED. He leans back and looks towards her. MAN, IN EVENING DRESS, leans forward and looks at Wendy. CAMERA ZOOMS IN on them. M.S.: Wendy, holding knife, at top of stairs backs away - then turns and runs away along corridor, exiting cam.L at end.
plotSummary.subtext: Hotel's depravity revealed - Wendy encounters sexual ghost vision. 1920s aristocratic perversion. Hotel showing its true nature.

characterInsights.Wendy: Horrified by hotel's supernatural sexual depravity - another trauma layered on top of Jack's violence

supernaturalElements: Ghost manifestation - man in dog costume and man in evening dress from 1920s

location.description: Hotel landing with Wendy at top of stairs looking into open bedroom doorway where two ghost figures perform sexual act

time.narrative: Thursday night - Hotel reveals its depravity

Wendy.state: Shocked, horrified, fleeing from supernatural sexual vision
Wendy.arc: Overwhelmed - escaped Jack's murder attempt, searching for Danny, now confronted with hotel's depraved ghosts. Reality completely shattered.

scenes.significance: DISTURBING SUPERNATURAL SCENE - Wendy encounters one of hotel's most disturbing ghost visions: man in dog costume with man in evening dress. Reveals hotel's history of aristocratic sexual depravity. Adds another layer of horror - not just Jack's violence but hotel's own twisted past. Wendy fleeing from multiple horrors simultaneously.

scenes.title: INT. HOTEL - LOBBY / EXT. HOTEL - M.S. / M.L.S. / EXT. MAZE

plotSummary.brief: Jack turns on exterior lights and pursues Danny outside; Danny runs into the hedge maze
plotSummary.detailed: INT. LOBBY - M.L.S.: Jack, holding axe, limps forward and moves L-R through entrance. He walks away to open door. CAMERA TRACKS after him. He stops in doorway. EXT. OVERLOOK HOTEL - NIGHT - M.L.S.: Shooting from door. Halloran's Snowcat in b.g. CAMERA PANS L-R. INT. HOTEL - LOBBY - M.S.: Jack, holding axe, at open doorway. He comes in and moves L-R to switch panel on wall. He opens cover and presses switches down. He leans towards open doorway and watches lights going on outside. EXT. HOTEL - M.S.: Danny crouched behind track of Halloran's Snowcat. He peers round corner. EXT. HOTEL - M.S.: Jack limps to open doorway and stops. 'Danny!' M.S.: Danny by track of Halloran's Snowcat. He moves away L-R. M.L.S.: Jack limps away from door. 'Danny!' M.S.: Danny runs L-R and exits cam.R. M.S.: Jack limping L-R from hotel. CAMERA TRACKS with him. 'Danny!' M.L.S.: DANNY RUNNING AWAY L-R ACROSS SNOW. CAMERA PANS WITH HIM. HE RUNS INTO MAZE. M.S.: Jack limping L-R. CAMERA TRACKS with him. Hotel in b.g. EXT. HOTEL - MAZE - M.S.: Danny running away through maze. CAMERA TRACKS after him. He looks back over his shoulder.
plotSummary.subtext: Danny uses Halloran's snowcat as cover, then flees into maze - his only escape from murderous father. Jack turns on lights to hunt better.

characterInsights.Danny: Smart survival - uses snowcat for cover, then runs to maze where he knows the layout
characterInsights.Jack: Methodical hunter - turns on exterior lights before pursuing, calls Danny's name while hunting with axe

location.primary: HOTEL LOBBY, EXT. HOTEL, HEDGE MAZE

Jack turns on exterior lights - hunter preparing grounds. Father hunting son with axe through snow at night. Callbacks to earlier scenes of Danny playing in maze now pay off.
